p: Shading by branch position can reduce isoprene and MT emissions from forest trees ( Esposito et al., 2016; Juran et al., 2017; van Meeningen et al., 2017). This suggests that cloudiness that reduces penetration of solar radiation to the canopy ( Niinemets, 2018) may reduce carbon allocation to volatile PSCs. However, in the canopy of Fagus sylvatica, MT emissions were highest in the semi-shaded leaves ( Simpraga et al., 2013).
